item.title: When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable
item.description:
When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable

Alex Lawson, Social Security Works & Sarah Badawi, Progressive Change Campaign Committee (PCCC) join Thom. Plus Special Panel Guest - Patty Lovera, Food & Water Watch. The Department of Justice is launching an investigation into the Dole Food company - one of the world's largest processors of fresh produce.

item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.title: A Turning Point for China?
item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Armenian Draft Bill Would Recognize Nagorno-Karabakh
item.description:
Armenian Draft Bill Would Recognize Nagorno-Karabakh

Armenia's government has approved a bill drafted by opposition lawmakers that calls for Yerevan to recognize the independence of Azerbaijan's breakaway Nagorno-Karabakh region. The draft bill was sent to lawmakers on May 5 for debate. In the past, the Armenian government has blocked previous proposals.

item.title: Trump Starts VP Search After Last Rival Drops Out
item.description:
Trump Starts VP Search After Last Rival Drops Out

With the Republican presidential nomination all but clinched, Donald Trump is beginning his search for a running mate to join him in the general election race. Trump, who has never held elected office, said Wednesday he is seeking someone with political experience as his vice president pick.

item.title: Former Presidents Bush Will Not Endorse Trump
item.description:
Former Presidents Bush Will Not Endorse Trump

Presidential candidate Donald Trump wants to bring unity to the Republican Party, but he will not be getting endorsements from the last two men the party sent to the White House. George W. Bush, who served two terms before President Barack Obama was elected in 2008, "does not plan to participate in or comment on" this year's race, according to his aide.

item.title: Rescuers Find Another Survivor in Nairobi Building Collapse
item.description:
Rescuers Find Another Survivor in Nairobi Building Collapse

Rescue workers in Nairobi, Kenya have found another survivor in the ruins of an apartment building that collapsed nearly a week ago, killing at least 26 people. Pius Masai, who is in charge of the rescue operation, told reporters Thursday that a woman they found is still trapped, but is able to speak with medics who are standing by to treat her after she is freed.
